title: Urban Beehive Initiative
description: Supporting urban beekeeping for environmental balance and biodiversity in Calgary communities.
fullDescription: The Urban Beehive Initiative aims to restore pollinator populations in urban environments through community-led beekeeping programs. We provide education, resources, and support to local residents interested in sustainable beekeeping practices.
impact: 500+ bees supported, 12 community gardens pollinated, 25 families trained

title: Solar Education Program
description: Teaching students and communities about renewable energy through hands-on solar panel workshops.
fullDescription: Our Solar Education Program brings renewable energy knowledge directly to schools and community centers. Through interactive workshops, participants learn about solar technology, installation, and the environmental benefits of clean energy.
impact: 200+ students educated, 8 schools reached, 15 solar installations completed

title: Community Garden Network
description: Building sustainable food systems through collaborative urban agriculture and community engagement.
fullDescription: The Community Garden Network connects neighbors through shared growing spaces, promoting local food production, environmental education, and community resilience. We provide land access, tools, seeds, and expertise to help communities thrive.
impact: 10 gardens established, 300+ families participating, 2 tons of produce grown

title: Youth Energy Leadership
description: Empowering the next generation of environmental leaders through mentorship and skill development.
fullDescription: Our Youth Energy Leadership program connects young people with industry professionals, providing mentorship, internships, and hands-on experience in sustainable energy fields. We focus on creating pathways for diverse youth to enter green careers.
impact: 50 youth mentored, 20 internships provided, 5 career pathways created
